documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: Air ticket policies do not support indefinite carry-over of unused balances between renewal cycles. Unused tickets expire at the end of each policy period and cannot be automatically transferred to the next cycle.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Customers must carefully plan multi-year air ticket policies by calculating total requests upfront. Unused tickets cannot be carried forward, requiring explicit policy reconfiguration for each cycle.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Calculate total requests needed across the entire renewal period and set that as the total number of requests in the policy. For example, for 5 annual requests over 5 years, set total requests to 25.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Policy Configuration > Renewal Cycles and Request Limits

documentation_candidates.summary: Air tickets - Booked tickets notification (tagging LM when not in approval flow OR workflow on ticket requests)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform cannot notify or tag line managers about air ticket booking completion when they are outside the formal approval workflow. Line managers who submit requests on behalf of blue-collar employees cannot track ticket processing status or receive automated notifications.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Line managers raising air ticket requests for employees cannot track completion status, creating communication gaps and requiring manual follow-up via email or other channels.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure line managers are added to the air ticket approval workflow so they receive notifications. Alternatively, use email or manual communication to inform line managers of ticket processing status.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Notifications > Notifying Line Managers Outside Approval Flow

documentation_candidates.summary: As an employee I want to manage my air ticket requests from my air tickets
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform does not provide a unified interface for employees to manage air ticket requests across different policy states (inactive policies, missing hire dates, ineligible status, awaiting encashment). Air ticket management is limited to specific policy conditions.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employees cannot independently manage air ticket requests when policies are inactive, employee records are incomplete, or eligibility criteria are not met. They must contact HR for clarification.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Ensure employee records are complete (hire date, probation end date) before assigning air ticket policies. Contact HR to verify policy eligibility and status.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Management > Employee Self-Service Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Letter requests - upload the document after stamping
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform does not support external document signing workflows for letter requests. Approved letter requests cannot be modified, have attachments added, or be returned to pending status. Users cannot download non-draft versions until approval, and approved requests cannot be re-uploaded with signed documents.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Organizations requiring external document stamping or attestation cannot use the platform's letter request feature. They must use external processes and email sharing instead of the built-in system.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Use external document management tools for stamping and attestation. Share signed documents via email outside the Bayzat platform.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Letter Requests > External Signing and Attestation Workflows

documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Expense Manager role has visibility to employee loans and air tickets beyond work expenses. The platform lacks granular permission controls to restrict Expense Manager access to only work-related expense data.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Organizations cannot restrict Expense Manager access to sensitive financial information like employee loans. This creates potential data privacy and security concerns.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Carefully assign Expense Manager role only to trusted personnel. Consider using custom roles if available, or request platform team to enable granular permission controls.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Role Permissions > Expense Manager Role Scope

documentation_candidates.summary: Restricted People manager role - can still see other employees (out of assigned group)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: Employee group restrictions only apply to finance and payroll modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can view and edit employee details (work tab, documents, departments) for employees outside their assigned groups. Role-based grouping does not restrict HR module access.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Organizations cannot enforce department-level or group-based access controls across all modules. People Managers and Adjustment Managers can access employee data outside their assigned groups, creating potential data privacy issues.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Use employee groups for finance and payroll modules only. For HR module access control, implement additional organizational policies or request custom development from the platform team.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Groups and Role Restrictions > Module Coverage

excluded.summary: Limited access for employees to view other users
excluded.reason: Feature is on product roadmap (Employee Grouping and Structures) but not yet implemented for HR modules. No current UI to test; requires backend platform team work.

excluded.summary: Need to delete the test air tickets processed
excluded.reason: Ticket confirms system limitation (no deletion of processed air tickets) but provides no UI behavior to test. This is a feature gap, not a testable bug fix or implementation.
